reviews.review_msg: I am currently taking ITAL 100 with Professor Vintila and he is one of the best teachers I've had in my life. He truly made me appreciate Italian language at an entirely other level. He is so caring and is always there if you need help. He is always accomodating to his student's needs and engages the whole class in his lectures. 110% recommended.
Such an inspiring professor. Make sure to attend classes to engage and you'll learn very well. A very fun course to take. Italian is not that hard, just need to get used to it.

really terrible. he does not use the course syllabus and I found this out when grades came back. his tests are too long and he takes too long with the listening, like we waste most of the test on it. he should grade on the syllabus that he showed us he needs to reduce his tests length and fix his grading then he would be a 3.5/5.

You teach yourself all the course material from the textbook while Vlad only goes over the questions during lectures. He is not clear on what he's looking for, and gives low grades. Also, he likes to pick on the people who do not understand the language. I left all of the INTRO classes feeling humiliated. BTW, a lot more difficult than it should be

I took Vlad's class in Spring2020 (rip) and he handled the move online rlly well. He cares about his students and helps as much as he can to make sure everyone is solid with the content and knows what they're doing. He is patient and really fair with his marking, but you do have to show up, put in effort and make sure you ask for help when u need.

Vlad is very knowledgable, but he is not a good teacher. He tends to pontificate about random topics that are sometimes not related to the text itself. His grading of participation is unclear and If you don't have a background in English or History this class will be difficult. He expects a high-level of understanding so come to class prepared.

he had our final exams marked THE NEXT DAY!!!! This literally never happens, most profs wait til the last minute to submit our results... easiest midterm and final at SFU hands down. yes he expects u to attend tutorials and make an effort in class, but he'll also do his share for us, which i respect. vlad vintila is the real MVP

Best prof at SFU hands down, super nice and easy going, accessible, and a very fair marker. Unpretentious and down to earth. Cares deeply for the topic he's teaching. I would have liked class slides though. Other than that, his classes are awesome and he makes the effort to make sure everyone understands or else can go and see him for questions.

Vlad is surely very knowledgeable, but he just isn't a great professor. There is absolutely no structure in the class and he marks the assignments with whatever criteria he prefers. He said he wants the students to participate but there is no space/forum for students to be involved and he then ultimately gives a 1/5 for participation. Never again!

Vlad seems like a great person, but he's just not my kind of professor. I prefer having at lease some form of notes or slides to review after class, but he doesn't do that. He also wasn't able to share his general grading criteria other than "I'm sure you'll do great." I would have liked more structure in class.

GREAT PROF! Marks quizzes and exams right away, always accessible in office hours and by email, funny and approachable, super friendly and easy going. Really makes the class fun. Lots of textbook use so be prepared for class. Definitely recommend as an excellent prof to seize your attention and interest in history.

Vlad is a great guy. He is so passionate about the subject and he takes the time to make sure everyone understood what they were doing. If you don't pay attention in class it will be confusing, but that's on you. All tests and quizzes consisted of stuff we went over in class many times. He is very interactive which makes lectures engaging.

Vlad is a great prof. He truly cares for his students' well-being. He even goes out of his way to make students understand course material and feel supported throughout their learning journey. Also, he is very genuine and super knowledgeable! I heard he speaks like five different languages, which makes him even cooler!

Vlad is great! he is very knowledgable and so approachable with students. Its true that there's a lot of reading but his exams and pop quizzes were so easy. He even made a outline of what to study for exams which was very helpful. His exams were no more than 30 mins to complete it. One of the best prof in SFU for sure. Hopefully he gets full time.

In my opinion, Vlad teaches in a way that is more suitable for arts students because they are very comfortable with heavy load of readings and able to think in an abstract manner. If you are a science or business student, this class will require a lot of effort for you because you are required to think in an extremely different way.

Vlad is a nice guy but this is definitely a class where you will have to put in a lot of work, meaning you must read all the readings in details and have good memories because he will test you on the smallest details. You will only do well if your learning style matches his teaching style. I got a pretty decent grade but expect a LOT OF WORK.

Best professor I've had at SFU! Have no clue what the bottom comments are talking about with the low ratings... Grading was very fair and his tests were easy as long as you read the assigned material. Very approachable and always asked class for constructive criticism. He even let us shape our midterm/final. Would definitely take again!! :)

This class and prof are one of the best I've had at SFU. This is not the class for students trying to get a degree with minimal effort and who don't like coming to class. I passed with an A in the course just by showing up to class and actually paying attention. Fantastic class and a GPA booster in my opinion!

He is a nice guy but doesn't know what he is doing half the time. He prepares for his lectures but he just talks continuously with nothing you can follow along with. The readings has nothing to do with his lectures because he expects students to read and memorize all the readings without any issues. The workload for this course is extremely high.

This is definitely not the course you want to take if you need B-HUM credits. Go take another course. This course is extremely time consuming and Vlad expects you to know every single detail. If you don't write exactly what he wants and everything that he wants on your midterm/final, you will not succeed.

Vlad is one of the nicest professors I've had at SFU! But he is horrible at teaching and his lectures are so messy. It is so hard to follow along with him unless you have history or religious backgrounds! If you want to do well for this course, memorize every single readings because his pop quizzes are worth 20% of your final grade.

Vlad is a very nice professor and would help his students as much as he can. However, this was a first year course but was not taught with the expectations for first year students or students who does not have history background. He does NOT use lectures slides and it is so hard to understand his accent. If you want to lower ur GPA, go for it.

The readings assigned were very tough to understand and were very long for an intro course. He does not go over the readings during lecture. Instead, he talks about random things that is not part of course material which makes learning quite difficult. His exams were not based on the textbook like he promised! NEVER AGAIN.

Vlad is the best prof I've had at SFU. This class was my first history class, and the reason I will be taking more history classes. Excellent lecturer, understanding professor and very helpful. He should be a full time prof at SFU!

Vlad is really interested in having his students do well and he wants you to succeed. There is a lot of reading but as long as you stay on top of it, it isn't horrible. Also, be prepared to participate in class, he really wants all the students to speak up. I loved having him as a professor as he is super knowledgeable and cute.

Vlad's a great professor - easily one of my favourites at SFU. Although there's a lot of reading, Vlad makes it accessible to all of his students. If you come to class prepared and keep up with the material, you'll do fine! He's also a great person. You should totally take his class.
